page.title: 03SALTWELLS NATURE RESERVE
page.content: SALTWELLS NATURE RESERVE IS THE LAST REMAINING AREA OF THE OLD PENSNET CHASE,AN AREA OF WOODLAND DATING BACK OVER A 1000 YEARS.THE GROUND BELONGED TO THE EARL OF DUDLEY.IN IT HE BUILT SALTWELLS HOUSE,WHICH IS NOW A CHILDREN'S HOME. IT IS CALLED SALTWELLS WOOD BECAUSE THERE WAS A WELL IN IT WHICH CONTAINED SALTS AND MINERALS.PEOPLE FROM AROUND ENGLAND CAME TO BATHE IN THE WATER. THE RESERVE OPENED ON AUGUST 10th 1981.IT STRETCHES 48 ACRES IN ALL.IT HAS MANY INTERESTING ASPECTS OF ECOLOGY.THERE ARE 80 SPECIES OF BIRDS,100 SPECIES OF FLOWERS AND 30 SPECIES OF BUTTERFLIES AT THE MOMENT.31000 YOUNG TREES HAVE BEEN PLANTED IN ONLY 3 YEARS AND 24000 OF THEM ARE GOING STRONG.IT'S A GOOD PLACE TO VISIT BECAUSE OF ITS INTERESTING HISTORY AND RICH WILDLIFE.
